#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Hakodate
#Text=Hakodate ( 函館 ) is a large city in southern Hokkaidō , Japan .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Hakodate is in the north of Japan , and is the largest city in southern Hokkaidō .
#Text=As one of the first cities in Japan to be opened to trade , like Yokohama and Kobe , there are some signs of foreign influence in Hakodate , notably architecture .
#Text=Hakodate has been one of the largest settlements of explorers of the Hokkaido island through and after the Meiji era , following the few years of the Republic of Ezo since 1868 ( see box ) .
#Text=Separated just by a 20-km strait of Tsugaru ( 津軽海峡 ) from Honshu , Japan 's main island , the city has naturally been seen as an entrance to Hokkaido .
#Text=It was the second largest city in Hokkaido until 1950s and still is the third largest with a 350,000 population , surpassed only by Sapporo and Asahikawa .
#Text=Hakodate , like Kanazawa and Nagasaki , is one of the hidden gems of Japanese tourism .
#Text=Everyone should see Kyoto and Tokyo , because they 're amazing cities .

#Text=But Japanese domestic tourists , having done those cities before , come in droves to some places that international tourists may not have heard of and appreciate the fabulous food , culture and history of some of Japan 's lesser known cities .
#Text=Hakodate should not be missed on a trip to Japan .
#Text=By plane
#Text=Hakodate Airport ( HKD 函館空港 ) ( is 20 minutes by bus ( ¥ 300 ) from the train station ) .
#Text=JAL and ANA offer nonstop service to Hakodate from Tokyo ( Haneda ) , Osaka ( Itami ) and Nagoya ( Chubu ) ; Air Do ( ADO ) also flies the Tokyo route and offers slightly cheaper fares .
#Text=There are turboprop flights to several other cities in Hokkaidō , as well as daily Korean Air service to Seoul .
#Text=By train
#Text=JR trains run from Honshu to Hokkaido via the Seikan Tunnel ( 青函トンネル ) .

#Text=With a total length of 53.85 km ( 33.49 mi ) and a 23.3-km ( 14.5-mi ) section under the waters of the Tsugaru Strait , the Seikan Tunnel is the world 's longest undersea tunnel , and the world 's second longest railway tunnel ( surpassed in 2016 by the Gotthard Tunnel in Switzerland ) .
#Text=Shinkansen services began running through the Seikan Tunnel in March 2016 , connecting Hakodate to cities including Aomori , Morioka , Sendai and Tokyo .
#Text=Hakodate has two major train stations :
#Text=Hakodate Station ( 函館駅 ) is in the center of the city and is served by conventional trains .
#Text=Shin-Hakodate-Hokuto Station ( 新函館北斗駅 ) is 18 km north of Hakodate station and is the northernmost terminal for the shinkansen .
#Text=Both stations are connected in 15-20 minutes by local services , including the Hakodate Liner ( はこだてライナー ) shuttle trains which are timed to connect with shinkansen services .
#Text=From Tokyo it takes approximately 4½ hours to reach Hakodate using the Hayabusa shinkansen service and the Hakodate Liner .
#Text=A one-way trip costs ¥ 23,010 in standard class , and is fully covered by the national Japan Rail Pass .
#Text=If you are just traveling between Tokyo and Hokkaido , consider the JR East-South Hokkaido Rail Pass , which is slightly cheaper than the national pass ( ¥ 26,000 for advance purchase ) .
#Text=This pass covers travel from Tokyo to Hakodate , and also covers express trains from Hakodate to Sapporo .
#Text=It can be used on any 6 days within a 14-day period .
#Text=Unlike the national pass , however , the JR East-South Hokkaido Pass only comes in one version for standard class travel .
#Text=Both Hakodate and Shin-Hakodate-Hokuto stations offer service to Sapporo on the Hokuto ( 北斗 ) limited express service ( 3½ hours , ¥ 8,830 ) .
#Text=Overnight travel
#Text=Overnight trains to Hokkaido were discontinued when the shinkansen began operations through the Seikan Tunnel in March 2016 .
#Text=For journeys from Tokyo to Hakodate , it is now easier to just make the trip during the daytime .

#Text=If you want to travel overnight over a longer distance ( i. e. from Osaka and cities beyond ) , you may wish to split up your journey - stop to visit another city along the way , or simply find a station along the bullet train route where you can find cheap accommodation , Morioka and Sendai are good options with lots of connections and a number of cheaper hotels .
#Text=An intermediate stop is a good option for Rail Pass holders , as only the lodging has to be paid for .
#Text=Seishun 18 Ticket
#Text=Since the Seishun 18 Ticket does not allow travel using bullet trains , users who want to go to Hakodate from Honshu must purchase a separate option ticket for ¥ 2300 .

#Text=The special ticket allows trips in any available standard class seat on Hokkaido Shinkansen trains between Okutsugaru-Imabetsu ( the last bullet train stop in Honshu ) and Kikonai ( the first such stop on Hokkaido ) .
#Text=It also covers travel on the private Isaribi Line between Kikonai and Goryokaku , where the rest of the local JR network can be accessed .
#Text=You must be in possession of a valid Seishun 18 Ticket to purchase and use the option ticket .
#Text=Trains to areas outside of Hakodate leave infrequently ( compared to areas like Tokyo where trains come every few minutes ) so plan ahead .
#Text=By boat
#Text=Hakodate 's main ferry terminal is 4 km from the center and reachable on buses 1 and 19 ; a direct shuttle is also available between the ferry terminal and train station .
#Text=Seikan Ferry and Tsugaru Kaikyo Ferry operate ferry services from Hakodate 's port to Aomori with multiple departures daily .
#Text=Trips take 3 hr 45 min .
#Text=One way fares are cheapest on the Seikan Ferry , ¥ 1600 for a carpet space .

#Text=The Tsugaru Kaikyo 's Blue Dolphin ferry offers several classes of service , from standard carpet space ( ¥ 2220 one-way ) up to a suite with two beds and an in-room shower and toilet ( ¥ 4940 one-way ) and a luxurious suite that adds a living room ( ¥ 12,340 one-way ) .
#Text=Note that during peak travel periods , these fares are higher .
#Text=Tsugaru Kaikyo also operates to Ōma on the remote Shimokita Peninsula , with two daily round-trips .
#Text=Fares start at ¥ 1810 for second class and ¥2220/2460 for a reserved seat .
#Text=Travel time is 1 hr 40 min .
#Text=Cars and motorcycles can also be carried on the Hakodate-Oma ferry , and on some of the Hakodate-Aomori ferries .
#Text=Tsugaru Kaikyo offers online booking of all of their ferry services in English through a third party .
#Text=Fares are paid in euros and reservations are confirmed within 48 hours of booking .
#Text=They also offer checked baggage service for an extra fee .
